summary: Internal FBI email chain regarding media inquiry from The Sun about whether the FBI intends to interview Prince Andrew as part of the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking investigation. The FBI public affairs specialist states they have no comment and no plans to interview Prince Andrew at that time.

persons.name: Amy J. Thoreson
persons.context: FBI public affairs specialist in New York who responds to media inquiry about Prince Andrew interview, stating the FBI has no comment and no plans to interview him.

persons.name: James Beal
persons.context: Journalist from The Sun who emails FBI press office seeking comment on story about FBI intending to interview Prince Andrew as part of Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: British royal who media reports suggest the FBI intends to interview regarding Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking conspiracy investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in sex trafficking investigation that media reports suggest may involve interviews with Prince Andrew.

connections.description: Media inquiry suggests Prince Andrew is connected to Epstein investigation and FBI may seek to interview him about the sex trafficking operation.
Journalist contacting FBI public affairs specialist for comment on story about Prince Andrew and Epstein investigation.

events.title: Media inquiry about Prince Andrew interview
events.description: The Sun journalist James Beal contacts FBI press office seeking comment on story that FBI intends to interview Prince Andrew as part of Epstein sex trafficking investigation.

locations: London, SE1 9GF (News Corp UK & Ireland Limited registered office)
keyFacts: On August 16, 2019, The Sun journalist James Beal contacted the FBI press office seeking comment on a story about the FBI intending to interview Prince Andrew regarding the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking investigation.
FBI Public Affairs Specialist Amy J. Thoreson responded that the FBI had no comment and no plans to interview Prince Andrew at that time.
The email reveals media interest in Prince Andrew's potential involvement in the Epstein case and the FBI's non-committal public stance regarding interviewing him.
The correspondence shows internal FBI coordination on handling high-profile media inquiries related to the Epstein investigation.
